comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Wife of Baron von dem Bussche-Haddenhausen, who was a German diplomat. See for example, NYT of Dec 1, 1903, select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F50716F63B5D1673... when he was First Secretary of the German Embassy in Washington. See also NYT of December 25, 1916 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F50A16FD3E5F1373... "OFFICIAL GERMANY SPEAKS; Sympathetic to Wilson's Note, Under Secretary Bussche Says."

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: This is not Gabriele von dem Bussche-Ippenburg IMO. According to the Evening star., October 31, 1903, Page 5 (with photo), the Baroness in the Bain photo was a native from Argentina (Gabriele von dem Bussche-Ippenburg was from Dresden, see familypedia.wikia.com/wiki/Georg_von_dem_Bussche_Haddenha...)

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: She was the former Maria Eleonore Martinez de Hoz (1875–1957), see de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hilmar_von_dem_Bussche-Haddenhausen, in German.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: @B-59: I agree. www.wikitree.com/wiki/Von_dem_Bussche-Haddenhausen-7 indicates that Georg and Hilmar were brothers.
